clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Ferumoxytol for the Episodic Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Pediatric Subjects With Chronic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Extension Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Ferumoxytol for the Episodic Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Pediatric Subjects With Chronic Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of episodic treatment of iron deficiency anemia (IDA) with ferumoxytol.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Several factors contributed to significant challenges in enrollment and led the Sponsor to discontinue the AMAG-FER-CKD-253 study as designed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the pattern of recurrence of IDA

clinical_study.condition: The Episodic Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Pediatric Subjects With Chronic Kidney Disease

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria include:
1. Subjects who have completed participation in study AMAG-FER-CKD-251 or AMAG-FER-CKD-252 within the past 4 weeks
2. Female subjects of childbearing potential who are sexually active must be on an effective method of birth control and agree to remain on birth control until completion of participation in the study
3. Subject and/or legal guardian is capable of understanding and complying with the protocol requirements and is available for the duration of the study
Key Exclusion Criteria include:
1. Experienced a serious adverse event (SAE) related to intravenous (IV) iron therapy in study AMAG-FER-CKD-251 or AMAG-FER-CKD-252
